ygData.subject: Re: Starting smithing...
ygData.msgSnippet: GOOD FOR YOU ANGARTH!!  Not wanting to do the mule or twinking thing! I too believe that it s silly to do that!  I mean, why take away so much from the game
ygData.messageBody:
GOOD FOR YOU ANGARTH!! Not wanting to do the 'mule' or twinking thing!

I too believe that it's silly to do that! I mean, why take away so much
from the game (earning it all yourself or with friends)??

I say again GOOD FOR YOU!

As to taking up smithing, realize that it is a time consuming and COSTLY
skill to learn (as I found out like others did)... There are sooo many that
want to learn smithing for the money... I myself started smithing because I
wanted to make my OWN armor to wear instead of buying it from others...
Which is why I still don't have full banded even though I am level 18...
hehe.. But I also get to waste lots of money making banded stuff that I can
sell... hehe...

Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server


> From: "Jones, Brian" <brian.jones@...>
>
> Hail Blacksmiths.
>
> I am a warrior of the 16th Tier and was looking to start a trade skill.
> Since I am a barbarian warrior and fit the mold of what a blacksmith
> 'usually' would look like, I have a few basic questions. First, someone
> told me that for ANY trade skill, intelligence is of utmost important.
Now
> I may be strong, but I am pretty simple minded (a 60 intelligence).
Should
> I even start being a blacksmith with such low smarts? How much will being
> 'dumb' affect me when trying to increase my skill? I thought about making
> another character that would be my blacksmith, but I really don't want to
do
> the 'mule' thing.
>
> Angarth, Warrior of the 16th Tier
> "Periissem ni periisem"
